name: Breakpoint
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
description:
Breakpoint

Abstract class that represents a breakpoint, which can be set and triggered in a debuggee application. Maps to gRPC struct Google::Devtools::Clouddebugger::V2::Breakpoint.

methods.name: id
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#id
methods.description: Breakpoint identifier, unique in the scope of the debuggee.

methods.name: id=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#id=
methods.description: Breakpoint identifier, unique in the scope of the debuggee.

methods.name: action
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#action
methods.description: Action to take when a breakpoint is hit. Either :CAPTURE or :LOG.

methods.name: action=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#action=
methods.description: Action to take when a breakpoint is hit. Either :CAPTURE or :LOG.

methods.name: app_root
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#app_root
methods.description: Absolute path to the debuggee Ruby application root directory.

methods.name: app_root=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#app_root=
methods.description: Absolute path to the debuggee Ruby application root directory.

methods.name: log_message_format
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#log_message_format
methods.description: Only relevant when action is LOG. Defines the message to log when the breakpoint hits. The message may include parameter placeholders $0, $1, etc. These placeholders are replaced with the evaluated value of the appropriate expression. Expressions not referenced in logMessageFormat are not logged.

methods.name: log_message_format=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#log_message_format=
methods.description: Only relevant when action is LOG. Defines the message to log when the breakpoint hits. The message may include parameter placeholders $0, $1, etc. These placeholders are replaced with the evaluated value of the appropriate expression. Expressions not referenced in logMessageFormat are not logged.

methods.name: log_level
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#log_level
methods.description: Indicates the severity of the log. Only relevant when action is LOG.

methods.name: log_level=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#log_level=
methods.description: Indicates the severity of the log. Only relevant when action is LOG.

title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#evaluated_log_message
methods.description: The evaluated log message when action is LOG.

methods.name: evaluated_log_message=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#evaluated_log_message=
methods.description: The evaluated log message when action is LOG.

title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#location
methods.description: Breakpoint source location.

methods.name: location=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#location=
methods.description: Breakpoint source location.

methods.name: condition
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#condition
methods.description: Condition that triggers the breakpoint. The condition is a compound boolean expression composed using expressions in a programming language at the source location.

methods.name: condition=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#condition=
methods.description: Condition that triggers the breakpoint. The condition is a compound boolean expression composed using expressions in a programming language at the source location.

methods.name: is_final_state
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#is_final_state
methods.description: When true, indicates that this is a final result and the breakpoint state will not change from here on.

methods.name: is_final_state=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#is_final_state=
methods.description: When true, indicates that this is a final result and the breakpoint state will not change from here on.

methods.name: expressions
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#expressions
methods.description: List of read-only expressions to evaluate at the breakpoint location. The expressions are composed using expressions in the programming language at the source location. If the breakpoint action is LOG, the evaluated expressions are included in log statements.

methods.name: expressions=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#expressions=
methods.description: List of read-only expressions to evaluate at the breakpoint location. The expressions are composed using expressions in the programming language at the source location. If the breakpoint action is LOG, the evaluated expressions are included in log statements.

methods.name: evaluated_expressions
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#evaluated_expressions
methods.description: Values of evaluated expressions at breakpoint time. The evaluated expressions appear in exactly the same order they are listed in the expressions field. The name field holds the original expression text, the value or members field holds the result of the evaluated expression. If the expression cannot be evaluated, the status inside the Variable will indicate an error and contain the error text.

methods.name: evaluated_expressions=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#evaluated_expressions=
methods.description: Values of evaluated expressions at breakpoint time. The evaluated expressions appear in exactly the same order they are listed in the expressions field. The name field holds the original expression text, the value or members field holds the result of the evaluated expression. If the expression cannot be evaluated, the status inside the Variable will indicate an error and contain the error text.

methods.name: status
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#status
methods.description:
Breakpoint status.

The status includes an error flag and a human readable message. This field is usually unset. The message can be either informational or an error message. Regardless, clients should always display the text message back to the user.

Error status indicates complete failure of the breakpoint.

methods.name: status=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#status=
methods.description:
Breakpoint status.

The status includes an error flag and a human readable message. This field is usually unset. The message can be either informational or an error message. Regardless, clients should always display the text message back to the user.

Error status indicates complete failure of the breakpoint.

methods.name: variable_table
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#variable_table
methods.description:
The variable_table exists to aid with computation, memory and network traffic optimization. It enables storing a variable once and reference it from multiple variables, including variables stored in the variable_table itself. For example, the same this object, which may appear at many levels of the stack, can have all of its data stored once in this table. The stack frame variables then would hold only a reference to it.

The variable var_table_index field is an index into this repeated field. The stored objects are nameless and get their name from the referencing variable. The effective variable is a merge of the referencing variable and the referenced variable.

methods.name: variable_table=
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#variable_table=
methods.description:
The variable_table exists to aid with computation, memory and network traffic optimization. It enables storing a variable once and reference it from multiple variables, including variables stored in the variable_table itself. For example, the same this object, which may appear at many levels of the stack, can have all of its data stored once in this table. The stack frame variables then would hold only a reference to it.

The variable var_table_index field is an index into this repeated field. The stored objects are nameless and get their name from the referencing variable. The effective variable is a merge of the referencing variable and the referenced variable.

methods.name: complete
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#complete
methods.description: Marks a breakpoint as complete if this breakpoint isn’t completed already. Set @is_final_state to true and set @final_time.

methods.name: complete?
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#complete?
methods.description: Check if the breakpoint has been evaluated or set to a final error state.

methods.name: valid?
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#valid?
methods.description: Check if the breakpoint is valid or not. Invoke validation function if breakpoint hasn’t been finallized yet.

methods.name: path
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#path
methods.description: Get the file path of this breakpoint

returns.description: The file path for this breakpoint

methods.name: line
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#line
methods.description: Get the line number of this breakpoint

returns.description: The line number for this breakpoint

methods.name: check_condition
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#check_condition
methods.description: Evaluate the breakpoint’s condition expression against a given binding object. Returns true if the condition expression evalutes to true or there isn’t a condition; otherwise false. Set breakpoint to error state if exception happens.

returns.description:
True if condition evalutes to true or there isn’t a
condition. False if condition evaluates to false or error raised
during evaluation.

methods.name: eql?
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#eql?
methods.description: Check if two breakpoints are equal to each other

methods.name: set_error_state
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#set_error_state
methods.description: Set breakpoint to an error state, which initializes the @status instance variable with the error message. Also mark this breakpoint as completed if is_final is true.

params.name: refers_to
params.description: Enum that specifies what the error refers to. Defaults :UNSPECIFIED. See Breakpoint::StatusMessage class for list of possible values

params.name: is_final
params.description:
Marks the breakpoint as final if true.
Defaults true.

returns.description:
The grpc
StatusMessage object, which describes the breakpoint’s error state.

methods.name: full_path
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint#full_path
methods.description: Get full absolute file path by combining the relative file path with application root directory path.
